Subtitles.Static: The savior of souls!
Welcome back, Trent. The usual?
Sure, I'll have two!
Any reason for this celebration?
Absolutely. Two reasons actually! First of all, I have finally managed to pay off all my debts!
For the beginning of a new life! This one's on me!
Thanks, friend! You are definitely the best person in this godforsaken place!
But if there's a "first of all", there should be "second". Go on and tell me, or else I'll die of curiousity.
Don't you dare die on me! I'd never get over the loss.
An old friend sent me a message.
Look.
Greetings, Trent! This is Alaric! Good news. I think we can fix the hole in your finnances. Meet me at Magdeburg, Sigma-13 System. See you soon!
What do you think?
I think you're the luckiest son of a bitch on this junkpile of a planet.
No, I mean... Should I agree and go there?

You could, of course, let things be as they are and do nothing. Got enough money to sustain yourself; a risk-free life, other than dying in your 40s working in the mine. But, I think, if life gives you a chance to get out of this mud-hole - it's a sin not to take that chance. But, it's your call.
So why aren't you flying away from this "mud-hole" yourself?

This, friend, is my mud-hole. I've grown into it and I love it. And I don't have friends like yours, asking me to drop everything I'm doing and come over to Magdeburg. And if I would leave, who's going to be the savior of strangers' souls?
You're right, without you this place would've been gloomy. I guess I'll head to the spaceport, then.
Good luck, Trent! Hopefully, we'll never meet here again.
Your ticket and documents, sir.
Trent?.. Are you...
No, just a coincidence.
I'm so sick of it. While my namesake was saving the universe, I was working my ass off to pay off those stupid debts...
Hi Trent, glad to see you!
You too, Alaric.
I heard that you've finally dealt with that problem. No more debts, no more duties, right?
Mhm, no ship and no money either. But it has its benefits - no problems with cargo holds. What's mine is mine.
A great time to start a new page in your life, isn't it?
I could use a partner for a well-paid job.
I'll give you a ship. An old one, of course, but it will definitely survive a few flights till decommission.
Gotta escort a few Rheinlanders from New Berlin to Bismark. They pay good, real good.
Interesting, why would Rheinlanders hire escorts to fly from one system to another, inside their own territory?
And a spaceship, you say? You're leaving me no choice, Al!
Excellent! The ship's waiting for you in the hangar. Check everything over, and I'll meet you outside when you're ready.
Guten tag, gentlemen. This is Trent, my friend I was telling you about.
Excellent. We're glad to see you. We have a few problems in our system. Hopefully, they didn't bother you too much.
A little bit. I'm just glad we made it here.
Great. If you're doing fine, then let's begin.
Thank you for the escort! The money's already being transferred to your accounts!
You're welcome.
Additionally, we, as members of the Hanseatic trading community, have added you to our freelancers' whitelist.
From now on, you can take any missions offered by the Hanseatic merchants.

And here's for a special thanks to you, gentlemen! Trent, have you heard? We are no longer some kind of beggers in Rheinland territory, but official freelancers accredited by the Hanseatic trading community!
Will I live...
And... Trent, a quick word of advice: As soon as you can, get yourself a newer ship to fly around in. No offense, but such antiquities are bought for novelty reasons. Not to actually fly in space.
I'll think about it.
So, how's your new life going, Trent?
Exciting. But... Now that I have my own ship, I'm ready to go down the devil's throat.
Now that you have the money to maintain and refurbish it. And to think it through - you should buy a new one. As painful as it may sound, Luts made a great point.
He can suck it. Maybe he has enough money to change ships every goddamn year, but I'm not a millionaire yet.
Then just think about upgrading what you already have.

On that battle, in the asteroid field, you most certainly didn't have enough energy. It certainly won't hurt you to get a better power generator. And take a look at the rest of the package. This chassis is very flexible in terms of upgrades. Most of its modules can be replaced with better ones...
OK Trent, I got some business to take care of. It requires my immediate attention so I better get going. Will you manage here without me?
I'll try... Good luck, Alaric!!!
Bye-bye!
Wilhelm, I assume?
Indeed, Herr Trent. I'm glad that you've chosen to work with us.

I haven't agreed yet, but I'm definitely interested. It's not every day that a representative of the Rheinland military messages my PDA, with a proposal to meet in person, on board a Rheinland military battleship.
Which messages are you referring to?
These ones... Shit. What's going on? They were right there...
To hell with those messages, Herr Trent, let's get to the point. And so, I hope you understand, that regardless of how our conversation ends, all its details should remain between us?
Should - means they would. You military guys don't like messing around... By the way, why me?
Why not? You proved yourself well in the Brandenburg Outpost incident.
Gotcha. Let's get to the mission, shall we?
Alright. Like any other government, we have some informants in territories of our, let's say, geopolitical rivals. You understand?
Sure.

Very well. Not so long ago, one of our informants contacted us via secure channel, reporting that he had extremely critical information and headed to our dedicated data transmission point. And, as traditional detective stories go, he never arrived there. No sign received from him during the last week, neither in the transmission point, nor through emergency channels. It can only mean one thing - he is dead.

Based on the analysis of chatter between station dispatchers and operators of emergency services in the area of our interest, with a probability of over ninety-nine percent, we've established that the ship of our informant was attacked, and he was killed.
My condolences. But what do I have to do with it?

Your mission is to find that ship and remove the data of interest from it. It has to be done as soon as possible, since the activity of so-called "Junkers" in the area is extremely high. You have to get ahead of them.
I doubt that I can get ahead of them. First of all, I don't know the area as well as they do. Secondly, unlike them, I'll be there on my own.

You can. The thing is, there's a tech enthusiast who's developing devices that can track them and listen to their radio comms. We've been interested in luring him into our department for a while now, so we're closely watching him.
Like you're watching me?

Even closer. He's been testing his devices in our area of interest. Therefore, he has the best intel regarding every event that recently occurred in that area of space. You'll have to get in touch with him, make an arrangement to get the informant's ship's wreckage coordinates, remove the data from it, and transfer it to us... Without letting any scavenger get to it before you do, naturally.
And that's it? Can I start now?
If you agree, there's no "I", but a "We". I'll be assigned as your partner for the duration of this mission.
Will you be in control of my actions?

No. I'll be your wingman and help you interact with the authorities - I have a fairly high level of clearance in Rheinland systems. The strategical and tactical sides of this operation are entirely on you, Herr Trent.
Thanks for trusting me... Where do I sign?
Ha-ha-ha. Why would we require such formalities? I'll meet you in space, Herr Trent!
Greetings!
Likewise. What'cha need?
Wilhelm sent me.
Very well.
And what does Herr Wilhelm need this time?
Coordinates of some wrecked ship.

Ah! Piece of cake. I'll throw in all the points of accidents involving damage to ships over the past month. Accuracy of twenty millimeters, give or take a few. Choose the one you need, filtered by criteria. No need to thank me.
We'll fly there together.
And why's that?

Wilhelm said that you'll point me to the place of our interest, and I'll have to find it. And how can I possibly know that you're not bullshitting me, to make a half-an-hour trip last till dawn? The military has their own quirks, and so does the freelancer.
A hundred times I curse the day I agreed to help Wilhelm.
And where's he now? Chilling in a bar on a nearby trading outpost?
Whatever happens out there, he has nothing to do with it, while you and I are the main characters.
So here's the famous Trent.
And what am I so famous for, Mr... Umm...
Reichmann. Admiral Reichmann, if you may.
It's my honor, Admiral Reichmann! So, what am I so famous for?
Oh, Herr Trent, lately some of the higher circles have all been talking about you! I hope Herr Wilhelm adequately pays for your work.
I'm not complaining.
Modesty - a commendable virtue, Herr Trent, I see virtue often taken for granted. I'll make sure the payment for your last mission will be doubled. All the best to you, Herr Trent!
So you think that he's the one we need?
Undoubtedly, Herr Admiral. He's the one who can help us accomplish all our tasks at hand.
Can you guarantee that?
Absolutely!
Very well, We execute your plan.
Thank you for your trust.
We will see what comes out of that. You're dismissed, Herr Wilhelm.
Oh! What's that, fiddling in our territory?
Some kind of scrap metal...
Here we go again, sorting junk.
Don't worry, it'll only take five minutes.
Greetings, gentlemen.
There you are, Herr Trent. Meet Herr Hassler. This mission will require both of you to tightly work together.
An honor to meet you, Herr Hassler.
And what will we do on this mission?
The usual thing. Fly, shoot, nothing new.
And someone is watching from a safe distance. Definitely nothing new. Can you be more specific?
Of course. Our intelligence managed to track down Dietrich's position. He's on an ex-military base in Konigsberg.
A strike fleet is preparing to attack that base as we speak. However, our analytics predict that a direct attack on Konigsberg would cause severe losses on our side.
That's why we're forming a mobile strike team, whose task will be to neutralize the base's defense systems by the time our main strike fleet approaches it.
You mean, those will be the guys who drag fire away from your asses.
Correct, Herr Trent. By the way, Admiral Reichmann personally insisted on your participation in this mission.

I'm flattered. Could you tell me how an elite military base, with top class defense systems, practically in the very center of Rheinland's territory, got abandoned and fell into the hands of rebels and Corsairs?

Herr Trent, at that time there were two such bases in Rheinland territory - Konigsberg and Regensburg, both in the Munich system, on the border with Kusari. The Kusari military saw Regensburg as nothing more than a pain in their ass.

During our last conflict with Kusari, we suffered a crushing defeat, and under the terms of a peace treaty we were forced to demilitarize Munich. The construction of Konigsberg was halted just before it was finished...

Our government couldn't bother destroying Konigsberg, or disassembling it. Maybe they hoped for the peace treaty to be re-negotiated so they can put the base into use, I don't know. Eventually, it appeared that Dietrich, one of the highest-ranking military personnel, having all the access keys, simply occupied it...
It seems that asking all sorts of stupid questions, like whether I have a choice, is inappropriate in this situation.
You're a wise man, Herr Trent.
Herr Trent, ninety percent of the local freelancers can only dream of being in your shoes. You're being paid generously, and reporting directly to Admiral Reichmann.
Why are you as nervous as a high-school student before graduation? Let's fly. I'll see you in space.

I asked the locals, they don't know shit. Anyways, thank you, Trent. Your work here is done, we'll be looking for the transport on our channels. Unfortunately, since we screwed up, Reichmann significantly cut the payment.
Strange. The base was destroyed, Dietrich's dead, and Reichmann freaks out because of some transport. I don't like this.
Me neither... The money's been transferred to your account. See you later.
Herr Trent, is that you?
Herr Trent, thank you so much for coming. I'm in trouble. The Rheinland authorities are looking for me.
I already guessed that. And I'm getting that familiar sense of someone trying to get me into trouble.
Herr Trent, you do not understand. A matter of utmost importance. I need to deliver important documents to Liberty.
And yet again I'm being dragged into a game of espionage... Jacobo, are you aware that I'm currently working for the very same Rheinland authorities you're trying to avoid?
Herr Trent, you're a freelancer. You did not take an oath. After the job is done, nothing connects you to your client.
Herr Trent, if we can deliver these VERY important documents to Liberty, to the Forbes system, they'll pay us a lot of money, and I mean a LOT, you see?
I probably won't make it alone, but with you on my side...
And if you don't help me, they'll probably just kill me...
I'm gonna regret doing that... So, what's the plan?
Herr Trent, thank you! You won't regret it! Launch into space. My friends will help me get to the landing pad quietly. Meet me in orbit.
See you there.
Gentlemen.
Miss Hatcher.
Miss Hatcher, you have such lovely, deep eyes.
Cut this nonsense immediately, you don't want to irritate me.
Let's get to our business. You've done a fine job.
I will avoid asking how you managed to escape Rheinland with THIS kind of material.
I'm a delicate lady, I'm afraid I might not be able to handle it.
We did what we had to do.

Heh, seems like you had fun. And by the way, we are looking for top-notch skilled Freelancers such as yourselves to help us perform, say, some non-standard tasks. Have you got any plans for the near future?
We've always got time for you...
Shut up, Alaric. Since we're now considered enemies of the Rheinland state, I suppose we don't have any plans yet.
So, if we have a couple of well-paid tasks that fit your field of work...
Then we won't hesitate to fulfill them. That is, unless these tasks make us enemies of the Liberty state, too.
Oh dear, no, I don't think it'll ever come to this.
Sure hope so...
Awesome, Trent! Who knew you'd be so good at finding clients and closing deals?
I'm also good at making enemies and getting close to being murdered.
Oh come on... You just started your freelancing career, a complete newbie, and now you're taking jobs for the government with appropriate payments!
Mhm, one of those governments have already put a price on my head. And oh do I hope they forget about me soon with everything that's going on there.
Seriously, the Rheinland military will most likely fall apart soon. They won't bother looking for us.
You seem very confident. Come on, Alaric, what are you hiding from me?
That Miss Hatcher, do you know who she is?
Well, of course I do! I've known her for a whole three hours! Screw you, Alaric.
She's an officer in one of Liberty's secret service agencies.
God dammit! Not again...
You don't get it. It's such a special and secret service, that not even their own counterparts in their own government know they exist.
Then how do you know that, Alaric?
Oh... I need to go...
I can't believe I got into this botch again!
This is commander Marcus Creitmire of the Hessian Lions spec ops unit.
Turn your weapon systems off immediately, and follow our lead. If you try to resist, we have the authority to destroy you.
Herr Creitmire, this is Admiral Reichmann. Congratulations for completing your task.
Take the Dromedary transport to the base for inspection. Your orders are to destroy its convoy.
How are you, Mr. Trent? Doing fine?
Well, Miss Hatcher, yesterday I twisted my ankle. And today, when I got out of the shower, I felt stinging pain in my back. But everything's fine regardless.
Mr. Trent! Let's try not to turn a polite greeting into a massive joke.
Then why won't we skip the politeness and get straight to business?
You're not making it any easier for me...
We've analyzed the documents you brought us, they proved to be of great value to us. However, there's only one problem.
There's always a problem.
They're complicated scientific papers, consisting of very advanced scientific calculations. So advanced, in fact, that our scientists couldn't stop arguing over their meanings.
You know, Mr. Trent, watching scientists fight each other is very entertaining.
Shame I couldn't watch them. So where do I come in? Surely you don't want me to watch over your scientists...
We'll need the help of a very experienced scientist, an expert in his field. Someone who could give us an accurate interpretation of these documents.
Luckily, I happen know a person of such skill; Professor Mandrake. If he can't figure it out, no one can.
And you can't just call him and ask for his help, because...

Because he works for Deep Space Engineering, and he's currently occupied with a research expedition. A very important one it seems, because it serves to counter industrial espionage that has ears deep inside our companies.
And my assignment will be...
Flying in space... Enough, Mr. Trent. You'll need to fly to Detroit station, which is DSE's HQ. Fond Professor Mandrake, and bring him to me.
I'll give you my business card in case you encounter any problems with DSE's security officers. Tell them you're working for me.
Alliance Security Force? Never heard of it.
It matters not, Mr. Trent. Your reward for completing this assignment will be very generous.
Ok, I'll get you what you need.
O-kay freelancer, now let's see what you are all about. You've got quite a mouth there, now it's time to prove your worth in complicated situations. I'll be watching over you... From afar.
Hey, bro! Got some more of that? I've been flying in space all day long, could use something to clear my mind...
No way, man! Been doing this shit for hours now, that's some of the good stuff!
Those jackasses from Deep Space really pissed me off. I did a fair job for them, and they can't even let me land on Detroit! Not even for a quick drop-off, these assholes just won't let me in!
And I have some really fine stuff in my cargo hold... Went on a months-long journey all the way to Omicron, and that stupid businessman just fends me off like I'm nothing.
And now, since they're apparently ready to kill me, I'm sitting here dunking myself in poison... Heck knows when they're gonna calm down...
Ah, could be really nice if I just stumbled upon a security pass... I'd just go and grab my hard-earned payment and get out with my hands full...
Listen, friend... What's your name?
Trent. And you are?
Smith. Mister Smith.
Nice to meet you, Mister Smith. You were saying...?
Yeah? Yeah... Oh, yeah! I know where you can get a security pass.
Oh, really? Where?

Look. There's a secret warehouse in this area. They got a couple of security passes kept there just in case, that I know for sure. You could try negotiating with them, but, you're a... Nobody. And the warehouse is top secret!
Gotcha, bro!
Come back with those full hands of yours...
Hey friend, I'm looking for some professor named Mandrake. Have you seen him around here?
I've never heard this name before.
Aren't you a nice one. Take a look, friend. I'm from the bartender's union.
Oh shit, you're one of these... Could you just show it to the camera over there, so that I can verify later?
Aha, thanks. He's on a research station in Sigma-17.
What station?
Re-se-arch Station. Got it? Strange, your kind are usually the smart ones.
OK, thanks for the info. You see how easy it is to just go ahead and melt the ice?
That's exactly what Humanity lacks – a little bit of warmth.
Professor Mandrake.
Miss Hatcher.
Professor, I apologize in Tilton's name for keeping you in your capsule an extra hour.
That bastard, I thought he was over you but he can't stop trying to catch you, Miss Hatcher.
The more he tries, the simpler and dumber his schemes become.
You'd better be wary of this kind of person. Statistically, if he tried enough times, he will eventually achieve his goal.
With Tilton? That's highly unlikely. He thinks that doing the same thing over and over again, expecting different results, is not considered crazy.
Yeah, but it's all about his "progressive ideas" that the Order have already outlived their purpose, and it's time for Liberty to stop playing around and end them once and for all...
Only childish morons like him would support his ideas.
Wait, wait, wait! Am I just a decoration here? Please explain what's going on.
It'll be very difficult and time consuming.
Let's start with the simple things, what's the Order?
It's not that simple, Trent... It's an organization...
That much I understand. Let's not force the information out of Miss Hatcher; give her the freedom of choice.
Tell him.
Fine. But what I'm about to say shouldn't just stay between us. This information is highly classified, and Trent, if you ever disclose it...
Yeah, yeah, I get it. You'll personally kick my balls.
Don't flatter yourself. It's a job for guys like Tilton.
Okay, I'm shaking in fear. Now let's get down to business.

Nobody knows how the Order was formed, or who formed it. All we know is that it used to be a powerful organization founded by people of massive influence. Their goal was to ensure humanity's survival by monitoring threats,
and they weren't interested in wars between nations. Not even the 80-year war, although they do deserve credit for making it an 80-year war rather than 200.
The Order only takes care of serious threats to humanity as a whole. One such threat has already come upon us a good while ago,
when we faced a parasitic alien race. That threat was isolated, all thanks to the Order.
A series of mysterious deaths among government officials of several nations, which the media described as unfortunate events.
Exactly. The media hushed it, even though humanity was on the verge of war between all nations, played by an alien race called "Nomads".
Disguised as "cross-border incidents".
Precise. Although, they were never really incidents. It was a full-on war involving everyone, Nomads included. A silent war, however, with the influence of the Order.
All those involved received their awards discretely, and everyone agreed it should never be spoken of again.
Major King, my own namesake, Jun'Ko Zhane?
He's smarter than he looks.
I picked him myself... And so, Trent, the Order gained massive influence over our geopolitical systems, putting the organization under immediate risk.
But, in our conservatively democratic society, the king of the hill rules. Whoever gets a chance to climb over by pushing others down, wins.
And so, an aspiring group of warriors decided to rise against the Order for no apparent reason.
If you sent them to battle against a Nomad fleet, they'll shit their pants and cry for their moms. But in the peaceful days of modern Liberty, they'll happily wage war against the Order.
And it goes without saying that the Order is run by people, not robots. Where there's people involved, conflict arises...
And they lived happily ever after, right?
The story's not over yet... And there's not really a happy ending. The Order split into two independent organizations: The Alliance Security Force, and the New Order.
So the Order is no more.
Well, not exactly. The Alliance Security Force oversees Liberty territories, among other things, despite resistance from some of Liberty's powers. Those powers are run by douchebags like Tilton.
But in no way does it mean that we forgot our main goal – to protect humanity from external threats.
If you say so...
Now, Trent, can I finally...
Sure.
Professor, Rheinland officials have gotten their hands on intel about Omicron Alpha...
And...
They've captured the objective and are making progress with it.
Rheinlanders are running experiments on the sphere in Omicron Alpha??? Are you out of your mind??? What have you done??? Mr. Trent was right... The Order really is no more...
About that Mr. Trent...
What else do you need?
Toss a coin to your freelancer.
Ah, yes, sorry. I'm transferring your credits. We'll be in touch.
Hey, what the hell was that?
Hey stranger! You don't look like you belong here. Did you lose something?
That stupid… I'm gonna finish that stoner off right now! He smoked his last blunt.
Let's deal with this douchebag first.
Freelancer alpha-one, turn your weapons down and follow us to battleship Griffin.
Freelancer alpha-one, I repeat, turn your weapons down and follow us to battleship Griffin. That's an order from commander Tilton. If you fail to comply, we will open fire.
This freelancer is responsible for no less than the destruction of the Clark research station! And I have the authority, by all means, to deal with him as I please!
I'm responsible for WHAT? The station blew up from the inside, while I was out in space waiting for...
Shut up, Trent!
Attention, we're reading hostiles on our radar!
What a coincidence, Herr Trent! Do you know what's the penalty for treason in Rheinland? That's right, death! All wingmen, engage!
Hey there, boys! This freelancer is under my jurisdiction. Calm down. He's on our side. Is that clear?
Shut up, freelancer!
Hello? Is anyone home?
A little bird named Mr. Smith told me that I can get a Detroit security pass for a reasonable price here.
What the... I was just flying to Forbes, what's the matter?
Miss Hatcher. Alaric, I didn't expect to see you here so soon.
Well, as soon as you contacted me, I flew to see Miss Hatcher right away. Looks like I was closer to Norwich than you were.
Gentlemen, now that we've all figured out when and how we all got here, shall we get down to business?

Great! So, as I mentioned before, there's an alien object called The Sphere. Originally discovered by The Order, nobody could understand what it is or how it works back then. And so, it got lost in time.

We’ve learned that Rheinlanders have discovered its key, and are currently running their experiments on it. We have reasons to believe that this will not end well for us. That's why we need your help in... ceasing these experiments, so to speak.

Ha-ha-ha! Perfect. So, if you guys can't find the key to The Sphere, then no one can! And if someone else finds it, then either the key or The Sphere itself have to go. Bravo! This way no one will ever get in there.

I don't appreciate you being sarcastic about it, Mr. Trent. It already happened once, when another group of Rheinland scientists discovered something in the Omicron sector... Oh, how I despise these Rheinlanders...
It escalated into the crisis that I told you about when Prof. Mandrake was here. You get the idea, right?
Yeah, I get it. Don’t open Pandora's Box.
Very well. Now that we’re done with the theory, let’s get practical. You’ll be receiving triple the usual payment, and you’ll be granted the privilege of being official partners of the ASF.
Hell yeah, I'm in! Where do I sign? I can make it a blood oath!
Calm down, Alaric. Miss Hatcher, what exactly is the objective? Destroy The Sphere? Kill the scientists? I can’t just do that - I'm not an assassin, after all.

Oh, is that so? Just kidding. No, it's nothing like that. Based on the secret documents you handed over, Professor Mandrake found a way to render The Sphere insensitive to external influences. To “seal it shut”, as the professor says.
I'll provide the full details, but only if you accept this mission.
I'm having a de-ja-vu. Only last time, I was called "Herr Trent", not "Mr. Trent"... On the other hand, it was a lot of fun. Alright, count me in.
Then I'll meet you in the orbit; we'll continue our conversation there.
Alright, gentlemen, our main objective is to eliminate a Rheinland scientist named Professor Rotterman.
Damn, I knew it.
Don't interrupt me, Trent! “I knew it” … Did you really think that for such a generous payment you’d be delivering sushi?
Time to grow up, Mr. Trent..
Alright, so, you’ll need to eliminate Professor Rotterman and find two artifacts: the Nomad Crystal and the Protheus Tome, which should be either in his possession or somewhere around him.
These artifacts were once kept hidden by The Order, but during the so-called "troubled" times, they got lost.
You take away those artifacts, and The Sphere will close itself.
The Order? "Troubled" times?
Later, Alaric.
Dammit, stop interrupting me! We're discussing an extremely important mission here!
The most important mission in your life, Miss Hatcher? Don't forget that WE are the ones doing the dirty work, and we deserve to know ALL the details leading up to our main objective.
Very well, Trent. So, first, getting inside The Sphere. It is very heavily guarded. Probably even more than the Rheinland Kaiser’s palace itself.

There is a military base near The Sphere; which looks like a shipyard capable of housing two battleships and four mid-sized vessels simultaneously. Do you understand the scale of the operation now? That's why a brute force solution is impossible.

In order to infiltrate the base, you'll need to use the devices you got from those little containers you picked up earlier. Those are cloaking devices, which make your ships invisible to both eyes and radars.
They change the local space curvature, essentially causing your ships to shift into a parallel universe.

Mounting them should be simple: Install them on your ships, connect them to the power generator, and route the cloak control button to your HUD. There's only one button - even you geniuses could never get it wrong.
Push the button once, and you're cloaked. Push it once again, and you're back to being visible.
But... there's only one problem. After turning it off, the device is rendered into a pile of melted plastic and metal. Simply speaKing, it overheats and becomes useless.
Should we bring fire extinguishers, then?
No, it's safe. Everything happens within the device itself, and you won't even smell it.

Now, it’s all about the timing. Not only is this a one-time use device, it also won't work forever, so make sure to use it effectively. Our big brain scientists guarantee it’ll work for at least 30 minutes. Potentially up to 40 minutes, but probably no longer than that.

If 30 minutes isn't enough for you, you could try staying cloacked longer, but at your own risk. If the cloaking device overheats during active use, the local space curvature collapses along with your ship.
And what happens to the ship? It goes to a different dimension?

I have no idea. Would you like to find out? That look on your face tells me the answer is no. Oh, and one more thing: you can't shoot while the device is working. Your projectiles won't be able to escape the local space curvature zone.
Here is the 3D map of The Sphere and all the other intel we managed to collect.
Wow, just look at it...
I'm glad you've come to appreciate its magnitude, Mr. Alaric. Please upload the data into your computer. You’ll be sending it over to Trend throughout the mission.

And lastly, after you’ve arrived in Rheinland, there will be complete radio silence between us or anyone else in Liberty. Otherwise, you will be pinpointed and the mission will fail before it even started.
That's about it. Onwards to your steeds, gentlemen.
You have a rare talent of getting into sticky situations, Alaric.
What are you talking about?
About what will happen very soon.
Are you talking about our mission?
About our SUICIDE mission.
Ah, but think of the profits!!! Besides, you could've said "no" at any time.
I'm afraid if I had said "no", I'd end up flying in space without a space suit.
Trent, since we’ve already signed this contract, we have to do it. Come on, Trent, let’s fly. Next time I’ll let you choose the contract, I promise.
Assuming there’ll be a "next time" in the first place.
Trent, we don't have much time. The bomb is already ticking.
I thought we were going to close the sphere, not blow it up!
We will. This is Hatcher’s plan B, just in case. We're gonna blow up the lab.
Got it.
Holy moly, look...
Trent we need to run! You can look at it later
Trent, we have a critical situation! Rheinland gunboats have just fired torpedoes at Missouri.
Our hyperdrive is not ready yet, and our defense systems won't be able to shoot down all the torpedoes.
But we need to unload the artifacts first...
No, right now they'll be much safer in your cargo hold than on Missouri. Get out there, quickly!
Captain Ceed, we found artifacts in this Freelancer's cargo hold.
Excellent. Good work, guys. Send the artifacts to the storage facility, and put the prisoners into the wardroom.
At ease, soldier. Go to the control room and tell them to order a transport. The prisoners need to be delivered to our base. In the meantime, I'll start interrogating them.
Sir, but what if...
No. They got shockers on them - they'll regret even thinking about it.
Yes, sir.
Don't worry, lads, I don't bite. Consider yourselves lucky that it all happened while I was on duty.
Also, forgot to introduce myself. Harry Ceed, captain of The Order, but also an ASF lieutenant working here undercover.
We're going to wait here for a little while, and then I'll help you get off the inhospitable board of Nebuchadnezzar.
Guys, I have a feeling that this is yet another trick from The Order and that this lovely captain is about to put us in front of a squad of fighters with assault rifles...
You got any better idea? Either way, being shot is probably a better alternative to being interrogated by Order specialists.
Captain, what about the artifacts?
They're being transported to an Order base.
And you allowed that?
What was I supposed to do? If I messed with The Order, I'd end up sitting down here beside you with a cute little shocker around my neck; rather than smoking my favorite brand of cigarettes.
So, what’s your escape plan for us?
First, put these clothes on
Then, follow me calmly to the hangar, to Mr. Trent’s ship.
Unfortunately, all the other ships are being taken down for spare parts. Luckily, Trent's ship is still in one piece. It’s like they say, the more people at the party, the merrier.
And after we're gone, how’s that going to affect you? You certainly won't be sitting here smoking a cigarette. Rather, you'll likely be trying to smoke a shocker off your neck.
Oh, no. You guys have knocked me out, there will be irrefutable proof of this.
Besides, a few escaped prisoners pale in comparison to putting the artifacts, which are sought by the whole Sirius sector, into the hands of The Order.
Clever, indeed.

Mr. Trent, I'd like to thank you for your work. Please accept our apologies for dragging you into such a dangerous situation, and I promise that I'll do everything I can to restore your reputation with us.
This is all well and good, but what should I do now?

Keep a low profile. Feel free to work a few odd jobs on this freeport, other independent stations, or hell, possibly even with the pirates. But under no circumstances should you return to lawful space.
If you're caught there, we won't be able to help you. You'll be turned into a scapegoat.
I must contact with ASF headquarters right away to discuss the situation and develop an action plan.

As a token of gratitude, I'm transferring you 5,000 credits from my personal account. Additionally, the promised reward from this mission still stands, and you should receive it as soon as our situation is resolved.
And what about a compensation for the mental damage?
Mr. Trent, frankly speaKing, you never gave the impression of a greedy man. You operate very patiently and very effectively in risky life-or-death situations. And you survived thus far.
Greedy people, on the other hand, tend to live much shorter lives in my experience. I'll be in touch once I’ve got any news for you, Mr. Trent.
ASF intel says this crystal is called 'The Nomad Seed'. If Nomads sense your presence, their ships will start pouring out of this thing.
The exit was somewhere around here, but it was automatically sealed after the Seed activated. In order to unseal it, you need to eliminate all the threats:
The only problem is, if you make too much noise, our Rheinland friends will join the party. So, you have to act quickly.
This is Delta leader; I'm sending you the coordinates for the Sigma-17 jump hole.
Captain Ceed, targets successfully intercepted.
Freeze them and deliver them to Nebuchadnezzar.
Alaric, there's something weird in here. Some kind of crystal, surrounded by Nomad ships.
Anything to drink?
I need a job. Preferably with good compensation.
We’re not in shortage of local freelancers, believe it or not. Remember which system we’re in?
Actually... I’ll work for minimum wage. Seriously, friend, help me - I’m totally broke.
Alright, Mr...
Trent
Very well, Mr. Trent. We do have something for you
A troupe of Liberty crooks recently took hold in our space. They call themselves Starline Robbers.
Your task is to eliminate their leader, Bill Ironside. I’ll send you the coordinates if you’re interested.
But as we discussed, your payment will be lower than usual
Sounds great, I’m in.
Hey, bro, where Rockford is?
This is none of your business.
Playing brave, shithead? Answer the question before you'll dive deeper into the problems
This will make you talk.
Where Rockford is, prick?
I'm Rockford
Follow me! Immediately!
Damn, Rockford, I'm immobilized!
Damn, Rockford, I'm immobilized!
I know.
Rockford, what's happening? You are an ASF agent, you must help me.
Rockford, what's happening? You are an ASF agent, you must help me.
I'm not an ASF agent.
But you're going to destroy the artifacts.
But you're going to destroy the artifacts.
The artifacts will survive the explosion of the ship.
Come-on old-junk. Turn on!
I need help! It is a matter of national importance!
Huh, is it really? If so, then you should ask someone representitive of the State.
Up there we have officer Darcy, she is one of a kind.
My name is Trent. I work for a secret organisation tied to Order, and I must contact them ASAP.
And another one... Mister, don't you know that trading artifacts of alien origin is illegal?
We caught a pair of dealers just like you recently. They were claiming to be agents of the Order too, when we jailed them.
Do you want to keep a company to them or, perhaps, their friend, Napoleon in a mental assylum?
I must deliver an artifact of great importance to the headquarters of our organistation as soon as possible.
Or else I will be put to death and possibly you too. Speaking of artifacts...
Oh, wow... Impressive.
How do I know that it isn't from some souvenir shop for tourists?
God damn it...
All righty then, I have a friend who is an expert on various rarities at a nearby planet.
Let him take a look at this thing, and if you're telling the truth, I promice you any help I can offer.
But if it is indeed a souvenir, mister joker, I promice you a teaparty today with Napoleon.
There is a problem. Almost all of the electric circuits on my ship is scorched, I'm not even sure how I managed to make it to this base.
All right, I will give you one of our ships.
But if you decide to use it to escape, keep in mind, that all of our ships are equipped with track beacons, so I'll find you anywhere.
Wow! Looks like this guy's area of interests is wast.
I'm interested in rare trinkets, that are profitable to buy and even more profitable to sell.
Greetings, Darcy.
Hi, Jabba. I want you to check out something.
Wow! Quite an interesting thing, clearly of alien origin.
If you're so happened to be broke right now, I can pay you ten thosands credits right away.
Oh, shit... So much for "drink a beer at the bar". Okay, Trent, we're leaving.
Jabba, you aren't a fool, are you? You will keep your mouth shut, am I right?
Of course, Darcy, of course...
Thank you, Trent. I understand that one good turn deserves another, but can't it wait a bit? Turns out not all of the trinkets this bastard had were "bought".
To convince some of the least conforming customers, he used the guys we just burnt near the station. All of this needs to be sorted out...
By the way, here is the official payment for your help from the Bretonian goverment. Ten thousands credits.
I'm still not going to sell you the artifact, Darcy.
Yeah-yeah. Very funny, Trent. See you later.
Try not to drag this, Darcy.
Freelancer, you've got something we want. Hand it over the easy way!
Boys, have you completely lost your minds? This is my turf, I'm the top cop around here. Trent, let's clean up this scum.
Hello. We're going to go into one room now, where there will be a couple of very big shots.
Please try to behave more restrained.
Didn't understand anything, but I will try.
Ah, this is Mrs.Darcy - our beauty and a hope for a bright future.
And this is, if I'm not mistaken, the expert on Order I was told so much about.
Yes, this is mister Trent. Trent, this is admiral Brighton and princess Caitlin.
And we have a matter of great importance for you, mister Trent.
What?Again?
Mr.Trent, let's keep it serious. The matter of discussion is Bretonian's state integrity.
I'll try.
We have a mission for you ... a mission corresponding to your specialty.
My specialty?
Odrer, Mr.Trent, Order.
Hmmm...Ah, okay...
Mr.Trent, I must inform you, that this mission is monitored by ... the most high rank officials of Bretonia.
The lone fact, that Princess Caitlin is present on this meeting, should speak volumes to you.
Of all the woes may God deliver us from both: from their love and their wrath.
I don't share your scepticism, Mr.Trent, try to be more sagacious.
You will do us a favor, and we, upon an opportunity, will do an offer to you in exchange.
Okay. What the task even is?
Now that's the spirit, Mr.Trent. Princess?
Yeah...
Mr.Trent, at some point in time, Bretonia have come to some agreement with Order.
In essense it was summing up to Bretonia, ehem...
Mr.Trent, have you heard of the Nomad problem?
More or less.
Good. A bit of caution won't hurt, you understand me?
So, according to this agreement, Bretonia abandoned its interests in the sectors of so called "The Nomad Legacy". Do you know what I mean, Mr.Trent?
Slightly.
Ehem, okay. In return, Order pledged to restrict the access to these systems for everyone. That is, to limit it completely. Do you understand me, Mr.Trent?
And we naively believed, that ASF, as a direct successor, would adhere to the established agreements. But what do we have now?
What?...
The fact, that those bastards from IRA are colonising Tau-44 at full speed.
Such bastards. Who's IRA by the way?
Not "who" but "what". A group of fanatics, including religious ones, demanding the independence of Ireland from the Crown of Britain.
Funny enough, considering that in the Sirius sector there is neither Ireland, nor Britain Crown.
Mr.Trent...
What? As far As I know, there is no house of Ireland.
But there are Irish, unfortunately...
Do you realize now how wild this is, Mr.Trent?
Let's assume I do. What do you want me to do?
To help us a bit. To fly to Tau-44 as a member of an operating squad and purge it from the IRA pressense.
Meanwhile, we suspect that ASF is directly involved in all of this. And here is where you come in handy.
As who? As someone, who will point at someone and say "He is from ASF"? Doesn't sound very convincing.
Uhhh...
Do fifty thosands sound convincing? You will just participate in a race, you don't have to become the winner.
The Olympic principle? For fifty thosands? Maybe I was too quick to say that there is no Britain Crown in the Sirius sector.
And you were smart enough to admit that. The direct leadership of this mission is on admiral Brighton, discuss all the details with him.
Gentlemen...
Trent, there is my battleship, Prince of Wales, on the orbit of the planet. Dock it, I will grant all the necessary passes and permits.
Trent, cya at "Prince of Wales".
Mayo... uhhm... Sorry, general King, mayor Screw, Trent has been delivired.
Thanks, Miss Hatcher.
Mr.Trent, I know, it was a wild ... ehem... couple of days for you...
Weeks...
Even mounths, but there are things beyond moral and physical exhaustion. At this moment it's very important to locate the tome of Proteus, so familiar to you, and the key.
For this reason, tell me, please, everything that has happened to you since the moment Miss Hatcher ordered you to go to Sigma-19 with squad Delta.
We were intercepted in Omicron Major, we didn't make it to Sigma-19.
Intercepted by who?
I don't know, some tough guys from a battleship named "Nebuchadnezzar". Then captain Ceed helped us to escape it.
Captain Ceed...
Captain Ceed...
Then agent Rockford contacted me. Or rather I contacted him...
Rockford?
Rockford. And he helped me retrieve the artifacts. But later it turned out he wanted to retrieve them to himself, and tried to destroy me. And he almost managed to.
In the very last moment, I sliped and saved this:
So Rockford knows
And in the game
And in the game ... yet... We need to fix that.
At this moment he is somewhere around state of New Order. We need an agent in New Order. An agent, that will track down his coordinates.
And will you provide him to us?
No, I won't. There are only a few of my agents left in the Order, they are being shot like partridges there.
Perhaps... Mr.Trent will help us?
Trent has wasted two artifacts, one cover squadron, and what are we going to offer him? To become an agent in Order ... General King, are you out of your mind???
Let alone he probably is an agent of Order.
But I trust this guy. Trent, let's do it this way: you're helping us, and we're going to erase your background before ASF and paying you triple the rate.
You know what? Screw you, general King. Lately, the only thing I'm doing is trying to fix my reputation and get big money.
But it always ends up with me being hunted and accused in even more severe crimes.
General King, can you remind us what was the name of the agent we introduced into the Order before Trent?
Who cares? We lost contact to him, he must be dead.
Nevertheless, General.
Alaric. I think, Alaric.
Bastards! What happened to Alaric?
We don't know. We lost contact to him somewhere at Kusari teritory.
He almost made it. He had to transfer a data base to us, but he did not get in touch. We don't know who got their hands on Alaric and his information.
You can help us and your friend. Find him, transfer the date your friend was supposed to transfer and you're free.
And don't even think about doing anything stupid, don't even think.
Okay... Fine...
Miss Hatcher, retrieve all data on Agent Alaric and hand it over to mister Trent.
Next, your task will be to escortthe tome of Proteus along with Trent and Miss Darcy to the research base.
Roger that!
Your mission parameters have been adjusted. We've received new intelligence.
The IRA base in Tau-44 has been destroyed, and there is reason to believe a... surprise was left for us in the debris.
Given these circumstances, you and Darcy, operating as private contractors, are to proceed to the sector and investigate what happened.
Trent??? What are you doing here? And in the company of a Bretonian officer, no less. I didn't invite you!
I'll tell you, Trent. Just don't make any sudden moves, or my boys will turn you and your Bretonian girlfriend to dust in a second.
Yes, Darcy, listen to your boyfriend, it's for your own good. I have the firepower advantage here. Captain Warfish, are the cruiser's batteries ready?
Capacitors charged to forty-three percent.
We have a couple of minutes, Trent. What is "here"? "Here" is the Nomad's Lair. What am I doing here? On the orders of my government.
The Order betrayed us. The Liberty government patronized The Order during its formation like no other, but as soon as The Order gained power, all that was forgotten.
All data on Nomad technology was seized and classified by the Order's top brass. After the schism, our agents managed to access a part of the ASF archive related to the Nomad's Lair.
This is a massive factory for producing Nomad fighter wings. If I can activate it, it will endlessly produce Nomad seeds.
Each such seed, directed at an enemy, unfolds into a swarm of fighters...
Capacitors are charged.
And you have the honor of witnessing this historic moment.
Captain Warfish, fire.
Uh... Commander Tilton, are you absolutely sure?
Yes! Goddammit, yes! And if you don't fire right now, Warfish, I swear I'll come up to your bridge and smash your head against the nearest console.
Copy that.
Yes, ma'am!
Attention, unidentified vessels! This is...
Bretonian girlfriend? Who the hell do you think...
You crazy bastard.
Trent, Brighton was the only... The only man... The only decent man among all these...
What you need to do is freeze. Don't even breathe.
Mister Trent. You haven't forgotten me, I hope?
You're a real piece of work, Trent. Red Leader, keep your sights locked on this character. If he twitches, you are weapons-free. You are personally responsible for him.
So, what happened here? And Trent, why is it that every time some shit hits the fan on the horizon, you're always nearby? Are you a shit-magnet? A plumber? WHO THE HELL ARE YOU?!
Perhaps it's better if I explain. One of your own — Commander Tilton — decided to activate a Nomad factory to produce fighter wings.
Instead, he overloaded it and caused a chain reaction, which resulted in the destruction of his cruiser, the battleship Prince of Wales that came to our aid, and countless people on both sides.
Tilton... A sick bastard with a god complex... I hope he suffered.
Fine. You will accompany me to our base. Red Leader, you are to remain here with the object's debris and begin a preliminary survey. I'll send some eggheads from the base to assist you.
And who are these guys? Since when does Liberty operate here?
Tilton. What are you doing here yourself? And "here" being where, exactly?
Darcy, not now.
Tilton, are you sure that after the "activation" everything will go as you said? That nothing will explode? That the Nomad fighters won't start attacking us?
I know, Darcy, but we need to...
Hatcher
Miss Hatcher, you are... unforgettable.
Well, Trent, ready?
Ready for what?
To meet the informant! We have no idea how many New Order agents are here!
I thought YOU were our cover! Or has the Bretonian Crown lost its influence in Kusari territory?
Hey, the Crown is doing just fine! But it doesn't stop laser cannon bolts! So play nice!
As you wish, Miss Darcy!
I'll be honest, it makes me nervous when everyone in the bar, including the bartender, is staring only at me.
You noticed it too, huh?
Hard not to. They're not just looking, they're staring a hole through me. Anyway, if this emissary isn't here in thirty minutes, I'm out.
Couldn't agree more.
Herr Trent, do you truly believe you are immortal?
Herr Hassler? Good to see you. Out of uniform today?
My service with Rheinland is over, Herr Trent. You are fortunate to witness the sunset of my military career in person.
But enough about me. Around these parts, you are a superstar. There is a very substantial bounty on your head...
Is that so... And what do I owe the pleasure?

And you aren't even aware. Ha-ha. Many think it's intentional, but I believe it's out of ignorance. You have crossed the New Order so many times hat its leadership doesn't just have nervous tics — they're having full-blown seizures.
I'd even say not just without a scratch, but walking away with a beautiful girl in your arms against the backdrop of a nuclear mushroom cloud.
Is that why everyone here is gawking at me?
Of course. To just waltz into the New Order's headquarters after all those exploits... Nevertheless, at this moment, you are perfectly safe, as was promised to you.
Hassler, right now I need answers to a couple of questions. The first and most important one is: where is Alaric and what happened to him?
Then you'd better speak not with me, Herr Trent, but with the head of the New Order, Herr Yamamoto.
And you can arrange that?
Precisely! And immediately!
Is this wise, Trent?
You are already in the New Order's headquarters. You should have been afraid earlier. Yamamoto-sama holds conservative views and deeply respects martial prowess.
I told him about our past adventures together, and it seemed to me he developed a certain respect for you. I don't believe you are in any danger.
Alright, let's do it!
Herr Yamamoto, Herr Trent, Frau Darcy.
Mr. Trent, I thought at my age I had lost the capacity for surprise, but you have simply astonished me. One could write an adventure novel based on your story. Perhaps even several.

One day you are a nobody, the next you work for the intelligence service of one state, then you become an enemy of that state, but waste no time and begin working for the intelligence service of another, with whom you also eventually find yourself in serious trouble.
Along the way, you casually consign the long-term plans of a supra-governmental organization to the trash bin. And now, here you stand, peacefully sipping sake with its leader.
Some sake, Mr. Trent? Miss Darcy?
Thank you, Yamamoto-sama.
Thank you, Mr. Yamamoto. I have business with you.
Otherwise, you would not be here.
I need to find Atticus Rockford.
And why is that?
I have a personal score to settle with him.
As does General King, it would seem.
Do not be evasive, Mr. Trent. I am not a bartender for you to pour your heart out to.
Besides, I have a feeling King doesn't hold warm feelings for you either...
if he sent you on a suicide mission...
A suicide mission?!
To eliminate Rockford, one man is not enough. Not even one as fortunate as you, Mr. Trent.
I don't give a damn about King, Mr. Yamamoto, or should I say, Yamamoto-sama? I have to kill that bastard and take back what he stole from me.
I envy you a little, Mr. Trent. You are young, you have passion...
I am willing to help you. Rockford is, as you say, "a bone in the throat" for us as well, correct?
But if you want my help, you must do a service for us in return.
And what does that entail?
We need to deploy special scanners and ensure their long-term operation.
Huh, interesting work... Could you be more specific?
We are interested in the Enterprise system. And all the defensive measures the ASF implemented after the Order's schism. We have the technical means to acquire the information we need.
They must be deployed and maintained within the Sirius system, which is patrolled by...
The ASF...
So, Mr. Trent, do you agree?
Why not.
In that case, you may depart. Lieutenant Kim will contact you. He will be overseeing the operation.
Trent, are you out of your mind? This is an operation against the ASF!
I've had the feeling for a long time now that I'm against everyone, Darcy. All I have left are temporary allies.
This operation was reckless!
Kim, stand down.
Now hold up your end of the deal, so our sacrifice isn't in vain.
I guarantee it.
Hey, Hassler, is everyone around here this crazy?
Not everyone, Herr Trent. But their... determination is inspiring.
That's one word for it. So, what now?
For now, we rest. Individual quarters have been prepared for you and Frau Darcy on the battleship. An escort will take you there.
Matome, you idiot, stop!
It's our only chance! Farewell, my friend!
Banzai!
Stop! No!
Herr Trent, Frau Darcy!
Fräulein.
What?
It's Fräulein Darcy.
Excuse me, but I believe we gathered here to discuss matters slightly more pressing than linguistic formalities.
Ja! Exactly. To business! Our recent... hmmm... maneuvers, as well as Rheinland's sudden military mobilization,have altered the overall situation. For the worse.
Who could have possibly imagined that a localized war with the ASF in a single system would alter the situation for the worse?
It was necessary, Herr Trent... And now we must react to the new circumstances.
Who do you need me to kill this time?
Nein, Herr Trent, quite the opposite. We need you to break a good man out of the Xeno prison. A hero of the war against the Nomads.
There was never an official war with the Nomads.
That does not negate the fact that there were heroes in it.
Be that as it may, what does this have to do with me?
You are not the first to attempt to free the person in question. The first was your friend, Alaric.
And Alaric screwed up...
Most regrettably, yes. Now he is being held in the same prison.
And you want me to repeat his glorious feat, so there will be three of us in there? At least Alaric won't be bored, and we can play a round of cards.
With all due respect to Herr Alaric, his capabilities are... significantly inferior to your own.
Alright then... If you say so, Herr Hassler. Oh, I'm so tired of this... And I'm fresh out of matches.
Alright, what's the plan?
The prison is in Omega-38. The system is mostly a dust cloud.The Musashi will position itself on the system's outskirts to avoid drawing local attention.
Herr Trent, you and Fräulein Darcy will lead the sabotage wing.Your ships will receive additional mimetic coating to allow you to slip into the prison undetected.
Your task is to disable the prison's defense systems.Then, our transport with the boarding team and an escort wing will move in.
Once the boarding party has done its job, everyone makes a... lively and fireworks-filled escape back to the Musashi.
Sounds tempting.
We'll see how it plays out in reality.
You may prepare for launch then. I will be coordinating the operation from the battleship's bridge.
I am so glad to see you, my friend!!! You saved us. I was starting to think I'd die in that hole!
Nobody else would volunteer to haul your ass out of the clutches of those fanatics, so I had to... Although, I was considering leaving you there as a lesson.
Buddy, I met a really good man in there. You're not gonna believe this. So... Mister Trent, meet Mister Trent.
A real pleasure! You don't get to chat so casually with a living legend every day!
"You rescued a legend from a mess he managed to get himself into headfirst out of sheer stupidity," is what you meant to say. I predict a brilliant future for you.
What, I'll make it into the government?
Don't make me laugh. Who needs those governments anyway?
Herr Trent, Frau Zane conveys that Lord Yamamoto urgently requires your assistance!
If it's from Frau Zane, then it's me she is asking. A pleasure to meet you, Mister Trent!
Herr Trent, Lieutenant Kym has located Rockford.
And if it's Lieutenant Kym... then that's for me.
Lately, it's not hard to get confused with all these Trents.
So, where is Rockford?
At Harajuku Station, Omega-7 system. We plan to detonate Herr Rockford's ship, but to carry out the mission, we need you to draw his attention onto yourself.
Hassler, do you call everyone "Herr"? Even scumbags like Rockford?
Unfortunately... My damned upbringing is hard to shake.
Alright, I'm in!
So, how are you holding up, prisoner of Azkaban, entrapped by honour?
Right now? Great. Back there... I was already saying my goodbyes to life.
Then why the hell did you get involved in all this in the first place?!

What else was I supposed to do? You have this badass friend who's been running circles around the intelligence agencies of multiple states,burning through enemies by the dozen, and always coming out without a scratch.
A guy's gotta try to measure up... So I thought... when they approached me... I'd play the spy game too.
You idiot, Alaric... Listen, I'm sick of all this. What if we just slip away quietly?
How do you mean?
We get in our ships and leave without a word, like proper Englishmen. I don't think they'll start shooting the moment we undock.
Then we make a run for the Border Worlds, take on simple jobs for small change. I'm so sick of this politics. I've lost track of who's against who, and who I'm even fighting for anymore!
It's too late to back out now. You fly off to the Border Worlds, and a week later some Hassler will show up and politely put a bullet in your head.
We're in too deep, my friend. We know too much.
Yeah... And the main reason is, I'm dying to see how this story ends.
Yeah...
Ah, come on, don't look at me like that. I'm not going anywhere. You'd just get into trouble again without me...
Let's see this action movie through to the end. Even if it's not yet clear whose end it will be!
That kid's good. A capable fellow. Don't you think?
As reckless as you are. He's helping the local fanatics instead of stopping them.
And who's going to stop them? Do you think I can talk Yamamoto down? He's more stubborn than Orillion and King put together.
Stubborn, greedy, and cunning. And Orillion is no longer here to keep him in check.
Yeah. That's why I'm afraid to go with your Plan A. But I have my own Plan B...
Rockford!
Trent?! Yeah, of course... have a seat...
Rockford, give me the Nomad key!
Why? So you can hand it over to the ASF? Or The Order? Who are you even working for these days?
These artifacts possess too much destructive power. If they fall into the wrong hands...
One lunatic named Tilton almost caused a local apocalypse in Tau-44 not long ago.They must be under the supervision of organizations such as the ASF or The Order.
And what do you REALLY know about The Order and the ASF? And who told you?
Trading artifacts has been a profitable business for a long time. And not the most dangerous one, I might add.
In the absence of an external threat, these organizations have turned to fighting for power.
For GLOBAL power, the kind that lets them ignore governments.The Nomad Key, the Proteus Tome, and the rest... in this game, they're nothing more than bargaining chips.
And if the need arises, neither the ASF nor The Order will hesitate to use themand cause, as you put it, a local apocalypse... in, say, the Forbes system.
Wow... Rockford, you just said more words than in our entire acquaintance up to this point.
All these Rheinlanders, the ASF... they are nothing more than children in a sandbox, playing with a live grenade they found.
And now they've grown curious about what happens if you pull the pin.
But I know how to end this. Right now. Once and for all.
In my future, there will be no Nomads. Or the Nomad Legacy. Only humanity.Perfectly safe from all this dangerous garbage.
Don't you want to help me build that world?
I... I don't know... What are you even talking about?
They didn't even tell you... How amusing.
Then at least stay out of my way, Trent. My regards.
Oh, what is all this garbage, what's the point?
Damn it... There's been no message from Kym!
Trent, Rockford is getting away! Get to your ship, now!
What about our team?
They're dead...
God damn it...
Kym, what happened with Yamamoto? Reichmann was surrendering. Where did all that hatred come from?
And Babylon? Why was it so poorly guarded? Where were the battleships, the swarms of fighters?
Kym, can you even answer me?!
Me... Not... I can't... Not yet...
Look. You know what, just cool off. We'll have work to do soon. Take a breath. I'll be in touch.
Fine... Do what you want...
Having a bad day?
Having a bad life.
For me you're incredibly lucky. And you almost done with Rockford.
I'm so tired. Seriously, I've had enough. You take a simple job, and it comes with a side of some guy who desperately needs your help.
He promises you the world—and then, bam! You're neck-deep in some intelligence agency mess with a hefty bounty on your head.
And you try to find your way out of this mess, but you only dig yourself a deeper hole.
In the end, you can't even tell friend from foe anymore. And the most important question is: what's the damn point of it all?

That's how it always is, namesake. You're a freelancer. You either take the small jobs: popping two-bit thugs in the outer systems, flying a rusty can for scrap wages... Or you end up in a mess like this.
And you know what? You got lucky. That credit balance of yours hitting six figures? What's your ride? Some brand-new, tricked-out ship, made just for you? Top-of-the-line weapons on every hardpoint!
And if you need to buy anything for your ship, you don't even bother checking the balance—you just know it's enough, and there'll be plenty left.
And most importantly... sure, you've got more and more enemies. But you've also made friends.
Not many, far fewer than the enemies. But they're real. Tested in battle. They've been through hell and high water with you.
And you know, no matter what happens, you can count on them. And these friends... they're actually worth far more than any six-figure account or a state-of-the-art ship with the best gear.
That's how it is. And feeling sorry for yourself is a powerful temptation, I know that firsthand. The trick is not to make a habit of it—it's bad for your edge.
You won't let me, will you?
I'll give you the facts. You call the shot...
I'm all ears.
Not here. We have to fly. I'll fill you in on the journey.
He's stealing the power core!
Stop him!
Damn, it's Rockford!
Alright, Trent. I hope you called me here for an important reason.
An extremely important one.
Then be so kind as to explain what this is about. Because I've noticed your little stunt in the Sirius system. I once again have the authority to arrest you.
Hey, Trent! What's going on? Why the rush?
Rockford has the artifacts, he's heading for the Sphere, and he intends to wipe out humanity.We have to stop him!
What kind of nonsense is that? How is he going to do that? Blow up the Sphere with dynamite? Trent, come up with something more interesting.
Rockford planned this operation back when he worked for the unified Order. There must be documents, plans about it here. Anything!
Nothing like that could exist. The ASF would never dabble in such nonsense!
Actually...
Professor? Do you know something about this?
Perhaps. I've seen similar documents in the archive, but they are classified.
They require the highest level of access, which only two people have — King, and someone else I'm not aware of.
I believe this access key should be sufficient.
Well, I'll be damned!
Is there something I don't know about you?
Alright, Trent. Suppose I believe you. But how do you plan to get inside the Sphere? You don't have the key for it!
I have the key to the Sphere as well.
Trent, confess, who replaced you?!
What's that now?
ASF Headquarters is under attack. All ASF forces are ordered to report to HQ
Enemy forces are superior... Who the hell is it?
Fuuuck... Kym mentioned a special operation... Goddammit... They actually went through with it.
Who did? With what? What are you talking about?
The Order decided to show who's in charge and eliminate their direct competitor.The Order is attacking the ASF, don't you get it?
To completely destroy the ASF and become the sole power in the Sirius sector. And they're doing it at the worst possible time.
Damn it! Who needs the Nomads when we're tearing each other's throats out ourselves! All for the sake of their ambition!
I won't let them get away with this! Let's move!
What's the status on Yamamoto?
We're conducting the interrogation. Would you like to be present?
Oh, yes! That reckless samurai has outdone himself.
I'd love to see what's going on in his head, or better yet, pickle his brains in a jar.
General King, we need to stop Rockford, now!
You're so obsessed with this Rockford... If he makes trouble somewhere, our forces will clean it up.
We'll run him down like a rabbit in the Border Worlds.He'll surrender on his own, you'll see.
General King, an incoming call from Professor Mandrake.
Put it on the main screen.
General King, Mister Trent, Miss Hatcher. Oh, I see everyone is here.
I've reviewed Rockford's so-called plan. As a scientist, I must say — it's sound.
ockford has linked about twenty Nomad laser weapons into a single, unified system.An interesting engineering solution, I must say.
He intends to fire the resulting beam at the Sphere to destroy it,and along with it, the entire so-called the Nomad Legacy.
And what will happen?
In simple terms? The Sphere will cease to exist.As will... approximately half to two-thirds of the Sirius Sector.
Well, that's ambitious!
HE... MUST... BE... STOPPED!!! Will you finally understand that?!
I'm with you, buddy!
I can't miss a show like this.
My resources are at your disposal. I'm assigning you our best special operations team.
And I'll be leading it.
Trent, hurry up! The briefing has already started!
We're receiving bad news from headquarters. The Nomads have begun their invasion of the colonies. The threat is far more serious than we anticipated.
Mister Trent and Professor Mandrake are currently upgrading the power unit we will send into the black hole while we still have time.
Situation: The Nomads are already in Omega-13 and have infested most of the system's asteroid fields.
Operation Plan: The main battle group, consisting of the battleship Osiris and its escorts, will attack the Nomad fleet to draw their forces away from the area adjacent to the black hole.
Simultaneously, a mobile sabotage team, comprising both Misters Trent, will proceed to the black hole via the old mining zone.
Sensors indicate minimal Nomad activity in that location. The route is expected to be relatively safe.
Any questions?
Why is the route through the mines only relatively safe?
A cluster of Nomad seeds has been detected in that area. They are dormant. If you are cautious and do not agitate the seeds, no other obstacles have been detected along the path.
Any other questions? No? Then launch on my signal. Good luck to everyone!
So, Al, ready to save the world today?
Hey! Look at you, finally starting to enjoy working for the intelligence agencies!
At least now I know what I'm fighting for!
Just make sure to watch your back, buddy. The stakes have never been higher!
Yeah, Trent. Even for a top Nomad expert like you, a little luck wouldn't hurt today.
Oh, come on! At this point, we're all experts on the Dom'Kavash, the Nomads, the Krieg, and everything in between.
Damn right we are! So let's use our expert knowledge and finally kick this alien scum's ass!
Ready to show them who the top humanoid in the entire Sirius Sector is?
Good luck, friends. Now, let's do this!
But... we're safe, right? Nothing's blowing up? It's all good, yeah?
All units, pull back to a safe distance immediately!
Holy cow...
Too late!
Everyone, attention! The Krieg has been detected in the system!
The laser has hit the Krieg! We were too late!
What's happening?
It's alive!
All ships, battle stations! We have no idea what that thing is capable of!
Missouri is being targeted, execute evasive maneuvers!
Ship engines are non-functional this close to the event horizon.
Suggest connecting the Nomad power core to the ship's systems.
Connection in progress.
Connection in progress.
Connected.
Don't lose hope! Here's an exit, follow me!
Ah, damn it... Seems it's not my day.
What's wrong?
The seed's radiation... it's wrecked my ship... How were you able to withstand it?
I don't know... So what do we do now?
Okay, listen... I'm transferring the beacon to you. You have to deliver it alone.
But my ship doesn't have a catapult!
I know, I know... damn it...
Namesake, give me the beacon. I have no choice, I'll carry it myself!
Hey, what's going on?!
And why the hell didn't anyone tell me that?!
Let's try it...
And make it quick!
How much longer?!
Faster!
Hurry up, goddammit!
